text: Forbidden Resilience
Eastern Necromancy is more volatile and the dead servants raised tend to be harder to destory.
Inexorable Warriors
Eastern Grave Guard are mostly raised from Jade Warriors, their expert training is evident beyond death.
Corpse Sinew Crossbow Strings
Human sinew tends to be more durable with more elasticity in the draw properly treated in embalming oils.
Death Chill Polearms
Imbuing ancient polearms with the very essence of corrupted Yin makes blades burn with cold.
Swarming Spirits
Raising the dead brings disharmony, angry spirits haunt the land in great numbers.
Cursed Munitions
Woe be upon those  who feel the damned fury of mine guns, for death is only the beginning of your enternal service.
Skin Sails
The flaying of men is a pass time for many evil creatures, and the material produced is thin yet durable. A "bloody" good fabric.
Balefire Elementals
Only in Cathay would a mad Scholar expose a Fire Elemental to Warpstone and bind it to a lantern.
Necromantic Protection
The mixing of Necromancy and the Art of Yin has produced great and terrible magics in the east.
Honoured Retainers
Secluded crypts and hidden tombs of humble warriors offer fine subjects for reanimation.
Dynasty of the Damned
I have sacrificed everything, my path is set and only ghosts share my dreams.
Pragmatic Neighbors
Despite what we or they define as "propserity" we are all interested in the concept..
